metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13346 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The mpatch_apply function in mpatch.c in Mercurial before 4.6.1 incorrectlyproceeds in cases where the fragment start is past the end of the originaldata, aka OVE-20180430-0004.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13346` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mercurial - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
mercurial-common - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mercurial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4').
